Run Base Model

Vignette Author

2018-12-20

run_model.Rmd

Introduction

Within this package there are 2 ways to run the deterministic model:

  1. run_modelb
  2. create_r_model

run_model will run the base model, which can be found in inst/extdata/odin_model.R. run_model is designed to quickly simulate transmission dynamics, and as such there are fewer parameters that you are able to change. Whereas create_r_model allows you to specify what model you would like to run. For more information please see the other vignette

Default Use

run_model can be used to simulate the base model and will return a list of 2 elements.

  1. dat - the simulation output
  2. plot - a plot of the 6 human compartments

Without specifying any function arguments, create_r_model will run a simulation for 1 year at an EIR of 10, with a treatment coverage equal to 40% for Tororo, Uganda.

library(hanojoel)
out <- run_model()
names(out)
#> [1] "plot" "dat"
out$plot

Passing Variables

To change simulation settings we pass in one of 5 function arguments:

  1. age Vector of age brackets.
  2. EIR Numeric of annual EIR.
  3. ft Numeric of proportion of symptomatic cases recieving treatment.
  4. time Numeric of length of time that the model will run for in days.
  5. admin2 Character of admin unit.

For example, to simulate Thies, Senegal at an EIR of 1 for 2 years at a treatment coverage of 60%:

We can also then plot other model outputs by interacting with the dat data frame returned by run_model:
